body.name: Seducing the Heartless Duke: A Steamy Historical Regency Romance Novel

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Challenge That Breaks The Ice !
reviews.reviewText: A Challenge is Made ! Whose Heart Will Crumble ? Who Will Melt With Seduction ? It all starts when The Dukes Brother becomes betrothed to a Lady and he then meets her Cousin. They become aquatinted and the Banter begins. They certainly can and do provoke each other as a sport. So they make it a wager. Who will fall first ? His heart is closed off from being hurt and will not allow himself to fall for the trap of opening it up to Love. She believes in a marriage with mutual Love. The Dukes Brother is a True Romantic and he and her Cousin are extremely happy and in Love. Making the two couples going out together interesting.Abigail Cadney lives with her Aunt any Uncle the Baron of Grouton . After her parents died they took her in and raised her along with their daughter Emma .Benedict Robbin’s the Duke of Stanton and his brother Phillip were very close. He was happy for his Brother when he got betrothed. Benedict’s heart was turned off to Love. He did not trust women after being left at the altar.Abigail and Benedict were brought together when Phillip introduced Emma as his Betrothed. Benedict was snooty and Abigail was not afraid to speak her opinion. So , the banter begins. It starts as a game and a wager. Only it gets Emotions Flying ! Little things start to happen ! Feelings Heat Up ! A Surprise Pops Up that could change everything !This story of Not Friends, To Friends , To So Much More , is Loving and Tender ! Delightful !

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Excellent story with four strong characters each with their own unique personalities. Lots of interaction, adapting to different perceptions and more. This author always does a great job with her stories. They are engaging from beginning to end, include romance, drama and joy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Trying to win!
reviews.reviewText: This was a wonderful story of a young woman and a Duke that are tormenting each other but soon realize they enjoy it! But then a bet happens and they have to try and win but who will? I voluntarily reviewed an Advance Reader Copy of this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A wager that leads to love

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very intriguing storyline.
reviews.reviewText: Two individuals, the Duke failing to believe in love and Abigail with a heart only wanting a love match, come together through a dare that played out so well true love enveloped them. After some intrigue all was resolved. Great read. Enjoy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Seducing the heartless Duke.
reviews.reviewText: Loved the book from beginning till end, Phillip and Emma were a love match. Benedict and Abigail seemed to have a sort of instant attraction to each other that neither of them wanted to admit. You have been one of my favorite authors, have loved reading your books.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love will find you.
reviews.reviewText: A delightful and engaging romance that starts out a bit rough, going through more ups and downs but finally ending in fairytale fashion. With all the action within this story will keep you entertained and attentive. With so much going on there’s no time for boredom!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Needs an editor!!!!
reviews.reviewText: This author needs to sit in a quiet room with no distractions and read what she wrote then make correction after correction. If this is an example of professional writing then the world of the written word is in trouble. The story constantly jumps around, at other times I wasn't even sure I was reading the same book. The descriptions of people and clothing worn to the same event were not the same. It was so distracting I kept going back to reread to make sure I was reading the same book. What gentleman would make love for the first time in a guest room just down the hall from the crowded ball with people walking in the hall just outside the door how disrespectful to the woman he's supposed to love. Both main characters waffled back and forth about their feelings often within the same conversation I got whiplash trying to keep up. Writing jumped from one day then back to another, then skipped back then forward to weeks then back to the same day, totally confusing. It was impossible to stay within the story.

Abigail and Benedict are two strong characters, both convinced of their abilities and determination. Seeing them beaten at their own game when they stand in their own ways to their HEA by a bet none of them officially but secretly wants to lose was highly entertaining.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: Will the path to Happiness Run Smoothly?
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed this well-written story Duke Benjamin had been jilted and was against marriage in the future. Abigail was an outspoken young lady but she captured his heart. I liked the way their relationship started with constant verbal battles and gradually they found shared ideals and interests. Both were strong willed and neither wanted to give way but deep down they both realised they were developing feelings for each other. The support of Benjamin's brother, Phillip, and Abigail's cousin Emma, helped both main characters to find ways to share experiences. When Benjamin's ex-fiancée appeared, the way forward was confused and Abigail was hurt. Would Benjamin be able to convince Abigail that he should trust him? Read on and enjoy.
The storyline is very authentic and very plausible. The attitude of the two main characters feed off each other. No one character is totally in charge.I also enjoyed the byplay of the siblings

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Benedict and Abigail story is one of how two people come from having a trouble some relationship to falling in love.

What started as a wager blossomed into loveLittle did both Abigail and Benedict expected their wager would turn into real love.Nice story with lots of bickering and passion on both sides. Once they put their differences aside they realised they can’t leave without each other.
